intro: Macaranga hispida, commonly known as the roughleaf makara, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are usually alternate, ovate, and have a distinctive pubescent surface. The flowers are unisexual and clustered in catkins, with both male and female flowers occurring on the same plant.
